Flix needs this loan to buy a computer for his wife's sewing workshop, to load sewing programs onto. He lives in his own home which is located in 16 de Febrero neighborhood, in the city of El Alto. He is married and has two children.

loan.use: To buy a computer for his wife's sewing workshop

loan.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El seor Ramiro trabaja como chofer con su taxi; el crdito lo requiere para la compra de un motor nuevo para su vehiculo, siendo esta actividad es la principal fuente de ingresos para su familia. Tiene tres hijos y vive en casa de sus padres, la mima queda ubicada en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. El la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y con Kiva.
texts.en: Ramiro works as a taxi driver. He needs the loan to buy a new motor for his vehicle. This business activity is the main source of income for his family. He has three children, and he lives in his parents house. The house is located in the Mirflores zone in the city of La Paz. This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and with Kiva.

loan.use: To buy a motor for his taxi

loan.name: Christian

texts.es: El seor Christian trabaja en una panadera; el crdito lo necesita para realizar un tratamiento odontolgico que necesita hacerlo lo mas antes posible. Es soltero y no tiene hijos; vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de El Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Christian works in a bakery. He needs the loan to have dental work done as soon as possible. He is single, and he does not have children. He lives in his parents house, which is located in the El Tejar zone in the city of La Paz. This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and with Kiva.

loan.use: Cost of treatment for his teeth and gums

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy an engine and a gearbox for his vehicle that he uses for passenger transportation

loan.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia A., who is married and has three children, was educated through senior high school. For the past three years, Sophia has been selling maize, cassava dough and charcoal in Takoradi near Effiakuma Estate. Married to an auto electrician, she uses her income to support her husband in taking care of their family. Sophia will use the loan to purchase more maize and charcoal for resale and plans to save the new profits from her expanded business.

loan.use: To purchase more maize and charcoal for resale.

loan.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence R. has been a hair dresser at Takoradi near Effiakuma Estate for four years. Educated up to senior high school, she is single. Her income helps pay for housing and household expenses. She needs the loan to purchase additional hair products in order to expand her business. The increase in the business as a result of the loan will be used to buy additional hair products for sale.

loan.use: To purchase additional hair products in order to expand her business.

loan.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes K. has been selling ladies wear, pampers and other items at Takoradi near Effiakuma Estate for four years. Educated up to senior high school, she is married to a mechanic, and they have five children. Her income helps pay for the childrens school fees and household utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more wares for resale in order to grow her business. She hopes to reinvest her additional profit.

loan.use: To buy more wares for resale.

loan.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua O. is married to a driver, and they have four children. She has received a junior high education. Ekua sells packaged sugar cane and plantain chips at Takoradi near Effiakuma Estate. She has been doing this for 7 years. Ekua uses her income to pay part of the school fees for her children.
Ekua will use the loan to purchase more sugar cane and plantain for resale in order to grow her business.
In this picture, Ekua is standing close to her sugar cane and the nicely packaged fried plantain chips (which are located on top of the sugar cane).

loan.use: To purchase more sugar cane and plantain for resale

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is married to a carpenter, and they have four children. She has completed her senior high school education. For the past 22 years, Rose has been selling banku (a Ghanaian staple made of fermented maize), fish and corn dough at Takoradi near Effiakuma Estate. Her income pays for her childrens school fees and the household utility bills. Rose will use the loan to buy more maize to grow her business. The new profit as a result of the loan will be reinvested back into her business.
In the photo, Rose has her hand on the corn dough she uses for banku.

loan.use: To buy more maize.

loan.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida A. is a seamstress at Takoradi near Effiakuma Estate. She has completed her senior high school education and is married to a teacher. They have two children. She has been a seamstress for two years, and the income helps pay for the household expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase lining, buttons, zippers, and others items to enable to her sew clothes for sale. This will help increase her income and expand her business.

loan.use: To purchase lining, buttons, zippers and others items to enable to her sew clothes for sale.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: purchase shellfish and shark fins for his fish stall

loan.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace S. is married to a businessman. They have two children. She has completed a junior high school education. For four years now, Grace has been selling condiments, oil and other items in Takoradi near Effiakuma Estate.
Grace uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. Grace will use the loan to purchase additional goods to expand her business. She would want to use the new profit to further the growth of her business.

loan.use: To purchase additional goods to expand her business

loan.name: Davi

texts.en:
Davi R. is married and has two children. She has not received any form of education. For six years, Davi has been selling corn dough in Takoradi near Effiakuma Estate.
Her husband is a caterer and Davi uses her income to help him with some household expenses. Davi will use the loan to purchase more maize to expand her business. For further growth, she wants to reinvest her profit back into her business.
In this photograph, she is taking out some of the corn dough into a measuring cup to sell.

loan.use: To purchase more maize to expand her business

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
For the past 12 years, Rose K. has been selling cereals such as maize and beans in Effiakuma Estate, Takoradi. Rose has completed a junior high school education.
Rose and her husband, a security guard, have one child, Roses income helps pay for the household expenses.
Rose will use the loan to purchase greater quantities and varieties of cereals for sale so that she can expand her business. She anticipates saving toward her child's education.

loan.use: To purchase greater quantities and varieties of cereals for sale so that she can expand her business

loan.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria N. sells provisions in Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi. Educated up to junior high school, Victoria is a single mother of one child. Having been in this business for two years, she wants to grow her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional provisions for sale and to reinvest the additional profits into back into her business.

loan.use: To purchase additional provisions for sale

loan.name: Ana Milagro

texts.es:
Ana tiene 32 aos de edad, reside en Guatajiagua, departamento de Morazn, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo don ngel y tres hijos Gerson de 14 aos, ngel de 12 y Gabriela de 9 aos de edad, Ana y su esposo trabajan para sostener el hogar, dedicndose su esposo a la comercializacin de loza y a la agricultura.
El negocio de las tortillas lo inicio hace 4 aos, con un horario de 9:00am a 2:00pm, este fue iniciativa propia como alternativa por las dificultades que enfrenta en ocasiones de escasez de dinero y materia prima. Actualmente necesita un prstamo para comprar maz y lea, para tener materia prima suficiente para continuar en la venta, esta ser una gran ayuda a la economa de Ana ya que el maz le es necesario para preparar tortillas y en este caso comprara abundantemente para disponer un largo tiempo.
Su objetivo por ahora es que sus hijos crezcan sanos, apoyarlos para que asistan a la escuela y estar a la expectativa para expandirse a cualquier otro negocio que sea rentable
texts.en:
32-year old Ana lives in Guatajiagua in the department of Morazn and earns her living by selling tortillas. She lives with her husband ngel and their children Gerson (14), ngel (12), and Gabriela (9). Ana and her husband work hard to provide for their family. Her husband sells pots and also works on the land.
Ana started her tortilla business four years ago on her own initiative. She works from 9am to 2pm. From time to time she faces financial difficulties and a shortage of ingredients.
Ana needs a loan to buy corn and firewood. She wants to have sufficient ingredients on hand so she can continue selling tortillas. This would give her welcome financial assistance--enough money to buy sufficient items to last a long time. Her goal for the time being is to raise healthy children and to support them through school. In the future she hopes to have another profitable business.

loan.use: to buy corn and firewood

loan.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort F. has been running a provision store in Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi, for the past nine years. She also sells food items such as those displayed on a table behind her in the photo. Educated up to senior high school, she is married and has two children Her income supplements her husbands, who is a photographer, and helps pay for the household expenses. She plans to expand her business by using the loan to acquire additional goods for resale.

loan.use: To acquire additional goods for resale.

loan.name: Charllote

texts.en:
Charllote A. is married and has two children. She has been selling charcoal at Effiakuma Estate near Takoradi for two years. Her husband is a technician. Charllotes income helps pay for their childrens school fees and their household utility bills. Charllote will use the loan to buy more bags of charcoal for sale to expand her business.
In this picture, A. is holding one of the sacks that has charcoal in it.

loan.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for sale.

loan.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es: Doa Mara tiene 64 aos de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulutn, vive con su hija y un N., doa Mara desde joven se dedica a la venta de semilla de maran, esta actividad le ha ayudado mucho para crecer a su hija y cubrir todas las necesidades que demanda el hogar. Ella est solicitando un prstamo, pues se est en la temporada de maraones, lo cual es el momento propicio para adquirir semillas y almacenar para un largo tiempo, por esta razn surge la necesidad del financiamiento, esperando comprar cuando los precios estn cmodos. Las proyecciones de doa Mara es mantenerse en el negocio, lograr la inversin para sacarle provecho y aumentar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Mara, 64, lives in Jiquilisco, Usulutn department with her daughter and a grandson. Since a young age, Mara has sold cashews. This activity has helped her raise her daughter and has provided for all her household needs.
She is asking for a loan because this is cashew season thus the best time to acquire them to store for a long time. Because of this the need for financing arises in hopes of buying when prices are the most affordable.
Maras projections are to stay in business and attain the investment to benefit from it and increase profits.

loan.use: To buy cashews.

loan.name: Fenita

texts.en:
Fenita A. is married and has one child. She has completed her high school education. Fenita sells tie-dye fabrics and local soap at Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi, which she has been doing for 8 years. She is also a seamstress. Her husband is a labourer. Fenita uses her income to help her husband pay for household expenses.
Fenita will use the loan to purchase raw materials to be able to produce more soaps and clothes for sale. The new profits will be reinvested to expand her business.

loan.use: To purchase raw materials for the production of more soaps and clothes for sale.

loan.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is a single mother of one child. She has completed her high school education and, for the past eight years, she has been selling tea and bread (a breakfast dish for those who want to break their fast outside the home) at Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi.
As the sole breadwinner, Grace is keen to expand her business to increase her income. She wishes to use her loan to purchase more beverages and other breakfast ingredients to cook for sale. She plans to save the additional profits she makes.

loan.use: To purchase more beverages and other breakfast ingredients to cook

loan.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba E. sells cassava, plantain and other food stuffs in Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi. She has been in this business for six years. She is married and has four children. Her income supplements her husbands, who is a labourer.
Aba plans to purchase more cassava and other food stuffs that her customers have requested. Her profits as a result of the loan will be used to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loan.use: To purchase more cassava and other food stuffs.

loan.name: Brenda Esmeralda

texts.es: Brenda tiene 23 aos de edad, esta joven vive en Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulutn, junto a su esposo, su hija de 2 aos de edad y tambin su abuela, Brenda se dedica a la venta de meriendas, trabaja todos los das de la semana, vende tortillas, enchiladas, pasteles desde hace 8 aos, comenzando muy pequea con el negocio. Ella solicita un prstamo para comprar productos de cocina, los cuales le hacen falta como aceite, maz y lea, al comprar dichos productos, mejorara su inventario, proveyndole lo necesario al momento que surja la demanda de alimentos. Brenda, aspira un negocio amplio, rentable y con clientes satisfechos por su buen servicio, tambin en su familia quiere darles lo necesario, que su hijo crezca sano y en un futuro poder iniciar la escuela.
texts.en:
Brenda, 23, lives in Puerto El Triunfo, Usulutn department with her husband, her 2-year-old daughter and her grandmother. Brenda sells lunches every day of the week. She has sold tortillas, enchiladas and cakes for 8 years having started with the business while still very young.
She is asking for a loan to buy cooking supplies she needs like: oil, corn and firewood. Buying said items will improve her inventory providing her with what she needs to meet demand for her meals when it arises.
Brenda hopes for a large, profitable business with customers satisfied thanks to the good service. She also wants to provide whats necessary for her family, that her child grows up healthy and be able to start school in the future.

loan.use: To buy materials like oil, corn and firewood.

loan.name: Philomina

texts.en:
Philomina B. is married and has five children. She completed a senior high school education. For 21 years, Philomina has been selling fruits at Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi.
Her husband is a tailor and Philomina supplements his income with her earnings. She helps pay for school fees and utility bills.
Philomina will use the loan to purchase more fruit expand her business. The new profit from her expanded business will be used to build a fruit shop.

loan.use: To purchase more fruit expand her business

loan.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia D. has been selling smoked fish for 10 years in Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi.
She received a junior high school education. She is married to a farmer and they have four children. Her income helps pay for school fees and utility bills.
To expand her business, she will use her loan to purchase extra fresh fish so she smoke a larger quantity. She plans to reinvest the profits back into her business.

loan.use: To purchase extra fresh fish to smoke

loan.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina M. is divorced and has one child. She has been selling wax prints for clothing for 15 years in Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi.
As the sole breadwinner, Amina wants to increase her income by expanding her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase additional prints for sale. She intends to save up the additional profits she earns so she can build a shop.

loan.use: To purchase additional prints for sale

loan.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: Doa Mara Julia, tiene 49 aos D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulutn, vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 25 y 21 aos D. edad, se dedica a vender tamales y leche, este negocio D. los tamales lo tiene desD. que sus hijos eran nios y la venta D. leche desD. que compra el ganado aproximadamente unos 12 aos. Actualmente solicita un prstamo para cancelar la instalacin D. la energa elctrica y otra parte para el negocio, esta inversin contribuir a solventarle esta situacin a doa Mara, que su vivienda cuente con un servicio ms y que es muy necesario. Para doa Mara Julia, sus objetivos son mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. su familia, y prueba D. ello es esta inversin que realiza, la cual no solo la beneficia a ella sino a su familia entera, tambin su deseo D. seguir trabajando es granD. para tener ms ganado y por enD. ms fuentes D. ingresos.
texts.en:
Mara Julia, age 49, lives in Jiquilisco in the Usulutn department. She lives with her husband and their two children, ages 25 and 21. She sells tamales and milk. She has had the tamale business ever since her children were young boys. She has had the milk business since she bought cattle, approximately 12 years ago.
She is currently requesting a loan to pay for the installation of electricity. She will use the other part of the loan for her business. This investment will contribute to resolving Maras situation so that her house will have this much needed service.
Mara Julias objective is to improve her familys living conditions. Proof of this is the investment that she makes. This will not only benefit her, but it will also benefit her whole family. She has a big desire to keep working in order to have more cattle, which will in turn proviD. more sources of income.

loan.use: Pay to install electricity in her house

loan.name: Saadatu

texts.en:
Saadatu L. is a widow and has six children. For the past five years, Saadatu has been selling wakye (rice cooked with beans) at Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi.
With her family relying solely on her, Saadatu needs to increase her income by growing her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase larger quantities of ingredients: rice, beans, and oil. She will save the extra profits she earns to build a better wooden structure for her business. In the picture, she is standing by the wooden structure from which she sells her wakye.

loan.use: To purchase ingredients: rice, beans, oil

loan.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila L. is married and has three children. She has completed her senior high school education. For the past three years, she has been selling onions at Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi. Her husband is a tailor. Jamilas income helps pay for their childrens school fees and their utility bills.
Jamila will use the loan to purchase additional onions in order to increase her sales. She plans to save any extra profits she earns.

loan.use: To purchase onions

loan.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Doa Mara, resiD. en Puerto el Triunfo, departamento D. Usulutn, su familia est conformada por su esposo y dos hijos, ella tiene 56 aos D. edad, su negocio es una tienda la cual la administra desD. hace 12 aos, trabaja todos los das D. la semana y cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo. Ella necesita un prstamo para comprar mercadera, ayudando D. esta manera a surtir el negocio, a mejorar la atencin a los clientes y realizar ms ventas. Para doa Mara el principal objetivo y por el cual trabaja todos los das es que sus hijos culminen la carrera universitaria, para que puedan desempearse como profesionales y mejoren sus condiciones D. vida.
texts.en: Mara lives in Puerto el Triunfo, department of Usulutn. Her family consists of her husband and two children. She is 56 years old, and for the last 12 years she has managed her store. She works every day of the week, and her husband helps. She needs a loan to buy merchandise, to stock her business, better serve her customers, and increase sales. For Mara the goal for which she works daily is for her children to complete their studies at the university, so that they can work as professionals and improve their living conditions.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

loan.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia A. is married and has six children. She has completed her senior high school education. For the past 20 years, Emelia has been selling general provisions at Effiakuma Estate, which is near Takoradi.
Emelias income helps pay for household expenses. Emelia plans to expand her business and will use her loan to purchase additional goods for sale. She will save the additional profits she earns.

loan.use: To purchase inventory

loan.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 38 aos de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulutn, donde vive con sus dos hijos de 18 y 15 aos de edad, tambin su esposa, la casa es propia, y l es empleado y agricultor. Carlos trabaja en la alcalda de Jiquilisco, y tambin desarrolla las actividades agrcolas y ganaderas los fines de semana. Actualmente est solicitando un prstamo para comprar todo lo necesario para sembrar y tambin comprar dos reces, ayudando as a llevar a cabo la siembra de granos bsicos y aumentar el nmero de ganado. Sus aspiraciones son que su milpa este en las mejores condiciones, aumentar su ganado y trabajar diariamente de la mejor manera, apoyando a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Carlos, 38 years old, resides in the Jiquilisco department of Usulutn where he lives with his two children, 18 and 15 years old, as well as his wife. They have their own house and he is an employee and farmer. Carlos works in the Jiquilisco town hall and also carries out his agricultural and livestock activities on the weekend. He is asking for this current loan to buy the materials necessary to plant as well as to buy two cows which would help him carry out the planting of basic grains and increase his number of livestock. His aspirations are that his crops are in the best condition, to increase his livestock, and perform his daily work in the best way to be able to support his family with the household expenses.

loan.use: Purchase of livestock and agricultural materials.

loan.name: Saadah

texts.en:
Saadah, a 44-year-old divorced woman from Bint Jbeil, has been working as a tailor and a beauty artist since 2003. Most of her clients are her relatives, friends and neighbors. She lives with her elderly mother and takes good care of her, saying that a mother is a blessing everyone must cherish.

Saadah is requesting her fourth loan from Al Majmoua in order to improve her business and to pay back money she borrowed from friends to pay for her mother's medication. Her previous loans have helped her a great deal, given she has no one else to help her in improving her business, economic, or social life.

All that Saadah hopes for is to have some rest after having confronted many problems that arose after her divorce and her mother's sickness.

loan.use: To improve her business

loan.name: Carlos Venancio

texts.es:
Don Carlos tiene 53 aos de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulutn, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 28 y 22 aos de edad, la casa en la que viven es propia, don Carlos se dedica a la siembra de sandia y hortalizas (pipan), este trabajo lo realiza hace 10 aos, lo aprendi por su padre. Actualmente solicita un prstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes, tambin tratamiento para plagas, esta compra le ayudara a que pueda realizar la siembra y que en un futuro pueda tener la cosecha.
El fruto de este trabajo le dar una mejor estabilidad, ya que comercializa la produccin para ayudar a su familia con los gastos que demandan mensualmente.
texts.en:
Don Carlos is 53 years old and lives in Jiquilisco, Usulutn with his wife and two children, 22 and 28 years old. The house where they live is his own.
For ten years, having learned farming from his father, Carlos has worked planting watermelon and vegetables such as squash. He is now seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, compost, and pest control products which will help him with the planting and with obtaining a good harvest in the future.
The fruit of this work will provide better stability since it will help with selling his products in order to support his family and cover the monthly expenses.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and compost

loan.name: Santos Cristobal

texts.es: Don Santos de 70 aos de edad, reside en Guatajiagua departamento de Morazn, vive con su familia en su mayora nietos, l trabaja para poder ayudar a sus hijos, dedicndose a la elaboracin de loza, este oficio lo aprendi desde nio, su padre se lo enseo, hoy da el comercializa y compra a pequeos productores, realiza el proceso de la quema de los productos, luego los ofrece en el mercado. La dificultad de don Santos se da en el invierno ya que se produce menos. Actualmente solicita un prstamo para la compra de mercadera para la elaboracin de sus productos como lea, nacazcol, loza cruda y el transporte, esta inversin ser una gran ayuda para don Santos, ya que fortalecer el negocio y aumentaran sus posibilidades de recibir mejores ingresos, dndole a su familia una mejor solvencia econmica para que sus hijos continen en sus estudios universitarios. Don Santos se considera satisfecho con la labor que ha realizado por aos, pero su aspiracin es ensear a sus hijos el arte de la alfarera, para que estos le den continuidad al negocio, por tal motivo l se esfuerza cada da a dar la mejor dedicacin a su familia y luchar por que tengan lo necesario.
texts.en:
Santos, 70, lives in Guatajiagua, Morazn department with his family, mostly his grandchildren. He works to help his children. He is a potter. He learned this occupation while still a little boy; his father taught him. Today, he sells to and buys from small producers. He bakes the items and then sells them in the market. His difficulty is winter which is when production drops off.
He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise needed for his production: firewood, nacazcol seeds (source of black ink), and unbaked pots and to pay for transportation. This investment will be of great use to him because it will strengthen the business and increase the possibility of obtaining better income thus providing his family with improved economic solvency so that his children can continue with their university studies.
Santos feels satisfied with the work hes done over the years but his hope is to teach his children the art of pottery so that they will provide continuity to the business. Because of this he strives daily to be more dedicated to his family and fights to meet their needs.

loan.use: To invest in firewood, nacazcol seeds, unbaked pots and for transportation costs.

loan.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia de 44 aos de edad, reside en Moncagua departamento de San Miguel, vive con su madre de 85 aos de edad, una sobrina de 17 aos de edad, tiene casa propia y se dedica a vender verduras. El negocio de Antonia est ubicado en un local del mercado municipal de Moncagua, ella solicita un prstamo para comprar verduras (tomates, chiles, zanahorias), esta inversin le ayudara a surtir el negocio, a realizar la compra por mayor cantidad, tener mejores precios, lo que adems le generara ms ganancias. El propsito de Antonia es agrandar el negocio y poder cubrir la demanda de los clientes, abrir un nuevo puesto para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Antonia, 44, lives in Moncagua, San Miguel department with her 85-year-old mother and a 17-year-old niece. She owns her house and is a vegetable merchant.
Antonias business is located in a stall in Moncaguas Municipal Market. She is asking for a loan to buy vegetables (tomatoes, chilies, carrots). This investment will help her stock the business, to buy in larger quantities, to provide better prices which will generate more profits.
Antonias purpose is to enlarge the business to meet customer demand and to open a new stand to increase her income.

loan.use: To buy vegetables (tomatoes, chilies, carrots)

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy fertilizer for her corn and bean crops.

loan.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Don Gilberto, tiene 58 aos de edad, reside en Gualococti departamento de Morazn, se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas, maz y frijol, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 20 aos y 15 aos de edad, ambos estudian. Don Gilberto tiene 20 aos de dedicarse a la agricultura, realiza sus cultivos en sus propios terrenos y aprendi el oficio de su padre. El solicita un prstamo para comprar abonos y fertilizantes, este prstamo le ayudara a contar con lo necesario para el proceso del cultivo y dar los cuidados necesarios obtener una buena cosecha. Su objetivo es que a travs de su trabajo su familia cuente con lo necesario en alimentacin, salud y educacin para sus hijos.
texts.en: Gilberto, who is 58 years old, lives in Gualococti in Morazn department, and grows vegetables, corn and beans. He lives with his wife and two children, 20 and 15 years old, who both study. Gilberto has farmed for 20 years, growing his crops on his own lands and learning the business from his father. He requests the loan in order to purchase manure and fertilizers. This loan will help him have the necessities for planting and take the necessary care of the land to improve his harvest. His goal is that through his work his family may have what they need in terms of food, health and education for his children.

loan.use: Purchase manure and fertilizers.

loan.name: Pastor

texts.es: Pastor, de 45 aos de edad, reside en San Francisco departamento de Morazn, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, ganado y pollo, est soltero vive con sus padres y hermanos. l se dedica desde hace 20 aos a este oficio aprendiendo lo bsico de su padre, luego tomo clases de agronoma, la produccin de su negocio la vende en el mercado municipal de San Francisco Gotera y tambin es su casa. l solicita un prstamo para comprar alimentos para los pollo, cerdos y vacas, especficamente harinilla y concentrado, los fondos de este prstamo le ayudaran a comprar al por mayor los alimentos, recibir mejores precios y este producto le durara vario tiempo. Las aspiraciones de Pastor es poder aumentar su granja de pollo y cerdos, ser mayorista y abastecer las tiendas de la ciudad.
texts.en: Pastor, who is 45 years old, lives in San Francisco in the Morazn department, and raises pigs, cattle, and chickens. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings. For 20 years he has worked at this business learning the basics from his father, then taking agricultural classes. He sells the animals he raises in the public market in San Francisco Gotera and also at his house. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase food (specifically meal and feeds) for the chickens, pigs, and cows. The funds from this loan will help him to buy the feeds wholesale. These products will last him some time and he'll get better prices. Pastor's dream is to be able to increase the size of his chicken coop and pig pens, and become a wholesaler to supply the stores in the city.

loan.use: Purchase food for chickens, pigs and cows.

loan.name: Senia Del Carmen

texts.es: Senia de 23 aos de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazn, vive con su esposo Cndido y tienen una hija Evelyn de 2 aos de edad, viven en casa de un hermano de Senia. Se dedica a la administracin de una tienda donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad, el horario de venta es de 6:30 am hasta las 7:00pm, ella aprendi de su hermano a llevar el control del negocio, actualmente solicita un prstamo para comprar mercadera y abastecer el negocio de algunos productos que son ms demandados por los clientes, su nico riesgo es la venta al crdito, pues algunos clientes no llegan a cancelar lo pendiente. Su sueo es crecer en el comercio, aumentar la clientela, ayudar cada vez ms a su familia pero sobre todo a su hija, para que cuente con lo necesario y tengan un futuro ms alentador.
texts.en: Senia, who is 23 years old, lives in Corinto in the Morazn department. She lives with her husband Cndido and they have one daughter, Evelyn, who is 2 years old. They live in Senia's brother's house. She works managing a store where she sells the basic necessities. The shop hours are from 6:30 am until 7:00 pm. She learned the business from her brother. Right now she's requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise and supply the business with some products that are in high demand from her customers. Her only risk is sales made on credit, since some customers don't return to pay off their accounts. Her dream is to grow the business, increase her clientele, and help her family more and more, especially her daughter, so that she has the necessities and they can have a more promising future.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise for the business.

loan.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Doa Blanca D. 46 aos D. edad, resiD. en San Miguel, vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos D. 18, 22 y 26 aos D. edad, se dedica a la sastrera, este negocio fue fundado hace 18 aos, aprendi el oficio en una academia D. corte y confeccin, trabaja todos los das D. la semana D. 6:00am a 8:00pm, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades en su trabajo. Ella solicita un prstamo para la compra D. materiales como hilos, ciper, telas, botones y broches, esta inversin es muy necesaria para ella y el taller, pues estos materiales son la base para la confeccin D. prendas D. vestir, adems D. que ayuda a fortalecer el negocio y continuar con este por un largo periodo. Su objetivo es mantenerse siempre trabajando, realizar sus trabajos D. la mejor manera y ayudar a sus hijos con sus gastos personales y educativos.
texts.en:
Blanca, 46, lives in San Miguel with her husband and three children who are 18, 22 and 26 years of age. Shes a tailor. She started her business 18 years ago. She learned her craft at a dressmaking academy. She works every day of the week from 6am until 8pm and to date has had no difficulties in her work.
She is asking for a loan to buy materials like thread, zippers, fabric, buttons and clasps. This is a very necessary investment for her workshop because these supplies are the basics for making articles of clothing. Besides, it will help to strengthen the business so that she can continue with it for a long period of time.
Her goal is to always continue working and to make her items in the best possible way and to help her children with their personal and educational expenses.

loan.use: To buy materials like thread, fabric, zippers, buttons and clasps.

loan.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 20-year-old single man who has owned an Internet cafe since 2006. It is a good business in most Lebanese villages because teenagers and students visit internet cafes to play games or do research. There are few entertainment options in many Lebanese villages. Ali is a hard worker who seeks to improve his business. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time. He will use the loan to increase the number of computers in his business and to buy a power generator. Electricity is a big problem in his region, and it is important for his business. Most of his clients are villagers and friends. He loves his business very much and hopes to improve it in the future.

loan.use: To buy computers and a power generator

loan.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro, reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, tiene 48 aos de edad, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 18, 22 y 24 aos de edad, l se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cultivo agrcola, este negocio tiene 20 aos de tenerlo, trabaja todos los das de la semana de 5:00am a 5:00pm, este oficio lo aprendi de su padre. Actualmente solicita un prstamo para la compra de 3 terneros, esta compra es significativa para l ya que aumentara el nmero de ganado y cuando estos crezcan poder aprovechar para tener una mejor ganancia. El objetivo de Isidro es mantenerse en el negocio, cubrir las necesidades del hogar y luchar por salir adelante junto a sus familiares.
texts.en:
Isidro, 48, lives in San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel department with his wife and three children who are 18, 22 and 24 years of age. He raises cattle and farms. Hes been in business 20 years. He works every day of the week from 5am until 5pm; he learned this occupation from his father.
He is asking for a loan to buy three calves. This is a significant purchase for him in that it will increase his herd size and when they grow he will be able to earn higher profits.
Isidros goal is to stay in business in order to cover household expenses and to continue struggling to get ahead together with his family.

loan.use: To buy three calves.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loan.name: Dora Concepcion

texts.es: Doa Dora, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 61 aos de edad, vive con su esposo, se dedica a una tienda, la cual se fund por iniciativa propia junto a su esposo, hace 10 aos, trabaja todos los das atendiendo de 5:00am a 7:00pm. Ella solicita un prstamo para la compra de productos domsticos como: aceite, arroz, frijoles, leche, entre otros productos, este prstamo le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y a ser ms eficiente con los clientes tenindoles todo lo necesario para el hogar. Su aspiracin es mantenerse en el negocio por un largo tiempo, ayudar a los clientes con un buen servicio, pero sobretodo tener lo necesario para ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Dora lives in El Transito, San Miguel department. Shes 61 years old and lives with her husband. She has a grocery store that she started with her own initiative together with her husband ten years ago. She works every day from 5am until 7pm.
She is asking for a loan to buy domestic products like: oil, rice, beans and milk, among others. The loan will help her strengthen the business and be more efficient with customers having everything on hand needed in the home.
Her hope is to stay in business for a long time, to help customers with good service but above all to have everything she and her husband need.

loan.use: To buy products: oil, rice, beans and milk.

loan.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: Doa Mara, reside en San Miguel, tienen 41 aos de edad, es empleada, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 14 y 15 aos de edad, ella labora como vendedora en un negocio de artculos de primera necesidad, trabaja todos los das de 7:00am a 7:00pm. Ella solicita un prstamo para comprar artculos educativos para sus hijos, ya que por el momento no ha completado el gasto que implica la educacin de sus hijos, este dinero del prstamo le ayudara a solventar esta situacin y que dar la oportunidad para un nuevo ao escolar a sus hijos. Su objetivo es trabajar por el bien de sus hijos, ayudando a su esposo para tener un hogar ms solvente y en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Mara, 41, lives in San Miguel. She is employed. She lives with her husband and two children who are 14 and 15 years of age. She works as a Salesperson in a basic need items firm every day from 7am to 7pm.
She is asking for a loan to buy educational materials for her children because shes not been able so far to gather the total amount her childrens education implies. The money from this loan will help her solve this situation and provide her children with the opportunity for a new school year.
Her goal is to work for her childrens wellbeing helping her husband in order to have a more solvent home and be in better conditions.

loan.use: To buy educational materials for her children.

loan.name: Floribel De La Paz

texts.es: Floribel, reside en San Miguel, tiene 35 aos de edad, vive con su madre y tiene 3 hijos Deris de 12 aos, Kelvin 10 y keylin 4 aos de edad, Floribel se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada como, sandia, meln, pia, la vende en trozos y en bolsas plsticas, por las calles de la ciudad de San Miguel, de 10:00am hasta las 6:00pm. Ella solicita un prstamo para la compra de frutas (mango, manzanas, melones, sandias), esta compra es importante para el negocio, pues quiere tener la suficiente para poder abastecer a muchos clientes, ya que las frutas tienen demanda y de la cual quiere estar preparada. Floribel tiene como objetivo, velar por las necesidades de sus hijos y su madre, trabajar diariamente para proveer para estos la alimentacin que necesitan, la salud y educacin.
texts.en:
Floribel lives in San Miguel. Shes 35 years old and lives with her mother. She has three children: Deris, 12, Kelvin, 10 and Keylin, 4. Floribel sells seasonal fruit like: watermelon, melon and pineapple. She sells them in chunks in plastic bags along San Miguels streets. She works from 10am until 6pm.
She is asking for a loan to buy fruit (mangoes, apples, melons, watermelons). This is an important purchase for her business because she wants to have enough to satisfy the needs of many customers because fruit is in high demand and she wants to be prepared.
Floribels goal is to watch after her mothers and her childrens needs, to work every day to provide them with food, health and education.

loan.use: To buy fruit (mangoes, apples, melons, watermelons)

loan.name: Carlos

texts.es: Don Carlos de 65 aos de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive con su esposa quien vende frutas y verduras, no tienen hijos y don Carlos posee un carro de alquiler, de esta actividad recibe ingresos, ya que de ofrece transporte a personas que deseen transportarse a otro lugar. Don Carlos tiene una larga trayectoria como motorista, pues sus empleos has sido especficamente como motorista. l solicita un prstamo para dar mantenimiento al vehculo, comprara amortiguadores, reparacin de tapiceras de todo el interior del vehculo, con esta ayuda contara con mejores condiciones para realizar el trabajo diario y ofrecer un viaje ms cmodo y seguro a los clientes. Para don Carlos el plan a futuro es comprar una unidad de transporte (bus), para realizar viajes.
texts.en:
Carlos, 65, lives in San Miguel with his wife who is a fruit and vegetable merchant; they have no children.
Carlos has a vehicle he leases; this is his source of income in that it provides transportation for people who wish to move from one place to another. Carlos has a long history as a driver since his jobs have been as a driver.
He is asking for a loan to maintain his vehicle. He will buy shock absorbers and repair the vehicles upholstery. With this help he will have better working conditions and provide more comfortable and safer trips to his customers.
Carlos plan for the future is to buy a bus to make trips in.

loan.use: For vehicle maintenance and for upholstery.

loan.name: Leonila Aracely

texts.es: Leonila, tiene 35 aos de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive con una hermana y un hijo de 17 aos de edad, administra una Boutique, ella comenz como vendedora en las calles, luego recibi el apoyo de su madre para instalar un negocio fijo, naciendo este negocio hace 3 aos. Ella solicita un prstamo para la compra de mercadera, surtiendo el negocio le ayudara a fortalecer y a proporcionar a los clientes una mejor variedad de productos como cosmticos y ropa. Esta oportunidad le dar ms estabilidad y mejores ingresos para su hogar, las aspiraciones de ella son instalar un negocio amplio, propio y con mucha mercadera.
texts.en:
Leonila, 35, lives in San Miguel with a sister and a 17-year-old son. She runs a boutique. She started out as a street vendor but later got help from her mother to set up a fixed business. This business was born three years ago.
She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to stock the store. It will help her strengthen it to provide customers with a wider variety of products like cosmetics and clothing.
This opportunity will give her more stability and better income for her home. Her hopes are to set up a spacious business of her own with lots of merchandise.

loan.use: To buy cosmetics and clothes.

loan.name: Sugey Del Carmen

texts.es: Sugey, de 32 aos de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive con sus hijos de 3, 5, 9 y 11 aos de edad, se dedica a la venta de cosmtico y tortillas, este negocio nace por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos, generando ingresos estables para cubrir los gastos y necesidades diarias. Ella est solicitando un prstamo para comprar maz y cosmticos, esperando con esta compra continuar en el negocio y ofrecer a los clientes siempre lo que necesitan, tambin su objetivo es mantenerse proveyendo ingresos y que no les falte nada a sus hijos. Su aspiracin es que sus hijos algn da terminen sus estudios y tengan la oportunidad de un empleo.
texts.en:
Sugey, 32, lives in San Miguel with her children, aged 3,5,9, and 11. She has a business selling cosmetics and tortillas. She started this business due to the need to support her children; it generates a stable income that she uses to cover their expenses and provide for their daily needs.
She is requesting a loan to buy corn and cosmetics, hoping that with this purchase she can continue with her business and offer her customers everything they need. In addition, her goal is to continue to earn income so that her children will lack for nothing.
She hopes that someday her children will complete their education and have good job opportunities.

loan.use: to buy corn and cosmetics

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: BUYING FRUIT TO SELL AT HER STREET BUSINESS

loan.name: Mayela Del Carmen

texts.es: Myela de 35 aos de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, vive con sus cinco hijos, es madre soltera y se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, este negocio lo inicio con el apoyo de su madre, ya que tiene experiencia en el negocio. Ella solicita un prstamo para la compra de cerdos para engorde, esta compra le permitir crecer y ampliar la granja de cerdos los cuales al crecer y engordar sern comercializados a buen precio. Las aspiraciones de Myela son ampliar el negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mayela is 35 years old, and lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel. She is a single mother who lives with her 5 children, and has a business raising pigs. She started this business with the help of her mother, who already had experience in this line of work.
Mayela requests a loan to buy pigs to fatten. This purchase would allow her to grow her business and expand her pig farm, where she raises and fattens pigs that she later sells at a good price.
Mayela hopes to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loan.use: to buy pigs to fatten

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loan.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: Luis, de 23 aos de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su familia, sus padres y su esposa, dos hijos, en la familia todos trabajan y solo sus hijos dependen de l; Luis se dedica a la venta de especias, este negocio comenz hace muchos aos, no tiene un horario fijo y actualmente solicita un prstamo para aumentar el negocio comprando equipo de transporte para movilizarse y vender a ms personas. El quiere comprar una motocicleta, este medio de transporte le ayudara abarcar ms zonas donde actualmente no puede llegar, espera que al conocer otros lugares pueda ganar ms clientes y que sus ventas sean mejores. El objetivo de Luis es seguir prosperando en el negocio, ampliar su zona de atencin, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, 23, lives in the El Transito in the department of San Miguel. He lives with his family, which includes his parents and his wife and two children. Everyone in the family works, and only his children are dependent upon him. Luis has a business selling spices. He started this business many years ago. He does not have fixed hours. He is now requesting a loan to expand his business by purchasing transportation equipment that would increase his mobility so that he could sell to more people. He wants to buy a motorcycle; this type of vehicle would help him to cover more territory by including areas where he cannot currently go. He hopes that by getting to know some other areas he can gain more customers and have increased sales.
Luis' goal is to continue to prosper with his business, expanding his business territory and improving the quality of life of his family.

loan.use: to buy a motorcycle

loan.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: Doa Mara D. 45 aos D. edad, resiD. en Concepcin Batres, departamento D. Usulutn, vive con su esposo y una hija D. 24 aos D. edad, en la familia todos trabajan y ayudan con los gastos del hogar; doa Mara se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, esta negocio lo inicio debido a la necesidad D. trabajar y junto a su hija, trabaja en un horario D. 9:00am a 1:00pm, tiene una gran experiencia en el negocio y actualmente est solicitando un prstamo. Dicho prstamo le ayudara a comprar maz, lea, gas, cal, estos materiales son los principales para preparar las tortillas y realizar las ventas diarias, esto le permitir contar con todo lo necesario y atender la demanda D. los clientes. Su principal objetivo es tener un negocio prospero, aumentar su clientela y tener una familia unida con buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and resides in Concepcion Batres, Usulutan department, with her husband and 24-year-old daughter. Everyone in the family works and helps with the household costs.
Maria makes and sells tortillas. She began this business owing to the need to work, and alongsiD. her daughter, she labors from 9:00 am until 1:00 pm. She has much experience in the business and presently, is soliciting a loan.
The loan will enable her to buy corn, firewood, gas, and lime, the principle materials needed to prepare tortillas and proviD. for her daily sales. This will permit her to have all that is necessary for the business and to meet customer demand.
Her principal objective is to have a prosperous business, increase her clientle, and have a united family living under good conditions.

loan.use: BUYING CORN, FIREWOOD, GAS, AND LIME TO MAKE TORTILLAS TO SELL

loan.name: Nohemy Del Carmen

texts.es: Nohem, D. 24 aos D. edad, resiD. en Corinto departamento D. Morazn, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, vive con su esposo don Felipe D. Jess quien trabaja como vigilante D. una Agencia Alerta Total, no tienen hijos actualmente. El negocio D. ella tiene un ao y medio D. existir, venD. tres das a la semana generalmente D. forma ambulante, el horario D. venta es D. 7:00am a 5:00pm. Actualmente solicita un prstamo para comprar ropa, ya que este negocio debe estar en constante renovacin, porque las prendas D. vestir van cambiando la moda y los colores que a los clientes les gustan, esta inversin ayudara a tener abundantes estilos y as ofrecer ms productos. Las aspiraciones D. Nohem es que a travs del trabajo que realiza diariamente, pueda ir cambiando las condiciones D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en: Nohem, age 24, lives in Corinto, in Morazn department. She dedicates her time to selling clothes. She lives with her husband, Don Felipe D. Jess, who works as a night watchman for a security agency. They do not have children. Nohem's business has been in existence for a year and a half now. She generally spends 3 days a week selling, going door to door. She is out selling from 7am until 5pm. Now she is seeking a loan to buy clothing because the business requires a constant turnover of stock. The garments have to keep changing with the fashions and colours her customers want. This investment will help her to have an abundance of styles and therefore offer a wider range of products. Nohem aspires to be able to improve her family's standard of living through the work she does each day.

loan.use: To buy clothing

loan.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Don Wilfredo de 49 aos de edad, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulutn, vive con su madre de 68 aos y una hermana 40 aos de edad, l se dedica a un taller de sastrera, el oficio lo aprendi de su padre hace 20 aos, no tiene un horario fijo para hacer sus trabajos ya que el taller lo tiene en su vivienda. l est solicitando un prstamo para comprar telas de diferentes colores y tipos, hilos de varios colores, ciper cortos y largos, botones y broches, esta compra le fortalecer el taller, ya que tendr todo lo que necesita para realizar los trabajos en relacin a las prendas de vestir, espera con esta inversin realizar de una manera ms eficiente y rpida los trabajos que demandan los clientes. Don Wilfredo aspira en el corto plazo una sastrera con capacidades grandes para la elaboracin de prendas de vestir, contar con un buen nmero de clientes y as mismo con mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 49 years old and lives in Jucuapa, in Usulutn department, with his 68 year-old mother and a 40 year-old sister. Wilfredo has a tailor's workshop. He learned the trade from his father 20 years ago. He doesn't work regular hours since his workshop is located in his home.
Wilfredo is requesting a loan to buy different colors and types of fabrics, different colored threads, long and short zippers, buttons and fasteners. This purchase will strengthen his workshop since it will mean he has everything he needs to carry out his work. He hopes that this investment will enable him to carry out work for his customers more efficiently and quickly.
In the short term, Wilfredo hopes to own a tailor's shop where he can make a lot of clothes, have a large number of customers and, thereby, improve his family's income.

loan.use: To buy different colors and types of fabric, different colored threads, short and long zippers, buttons and fasteners.

loan.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doa Mara Elena, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulutn, tiene 67 aos de edad, administra una tienda, vive con su esposo y una hija de 17 aos de edad; El negocio de doa Mara Elena es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, lo inicio hace 5 aos por iniciativa propia, est ubicado en un local del mercado municipal, lo atiende de 7:00am a 4:00pm. Ella solicita un prstamo para la compra de aceite, azcar, detergentes, leche y gaseosa, esta inversin es muy necesaria para el negocio, ya que sus inventarios se abastecern de los productos ms demandados por los clientes, logrando as satisfacer sus necesidades. Para el corto plazo doa Mara Elena espera tener un negocio ms fuerte, que el prstamo le permita realizar una mejora y que con esto pueda tambin recibir mejores ingresos y que el sistema de vida sea diferente.
texts.en:
Mara Elena lives in Jucuapa, in Usulutn department. She is 67 years old and lives with her husband and 17 year-old daughter. Mara Elena runs a store where she sells essentials. She set up her store 5 years ago on her own initiative. It is located in the town market and she serves there from 7.00am to 4.00pm.
Mara Elena is requesting a loan to buy oil, sugar, detergents, milk and soda. This investment is essential for her business since she will stock up with the products that are in most demand among her customers and thereby be able to meet their needs.
In the short term, Mara Elena hopes to have a stronger business. She hopes that this loan will allow her to make an improvement and that this will enable her to make better profits and enjoy a better quality of life.

loan.use: To buy oil, sugar, detergents, milk and soda.

loan.name: Mayra Clara

texts.es: Mayra, tiene 45 aos de edad, reside en Nueva Guadalupe, departamento de San Miguel, vive con su familia, tiene una hija de 8 aos de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de platillos tpicos, trabaja de lunes a viernes y prepara yuca, enchiladas, tamales, pasteles, entre otros. Actualmente solicita un prstamo para invertirlo en productos como yucas, maz, tomates, pltanos, bananos, condimentos. Estos son parte de sus materiales para preparar la venta, as con esta compra espera tener lo necesario y continuar su rutina diaria. Ella quiere seguir en el negocio, proveer todo lo necesario para su familia y ver la posibilidad que su hija contine en sus estudios y que al crecer tambin se prepare con una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Mayra is 45 years old and lives in Nueva Guadalupe, in San Miguel department, with her family. She has an 8 year-old daughter. Mayra works selling traditional meals. She works from Monday to Friday and prepares cassava, enchiladas, tamales, pies and other dishes.
Mayra is currently requesting a loan to invest in products such as cassava, corn, tomatoes, bananas, plantains and condiments. These are some of the supplies she uses in preparing her dishes. She hopes this purchase will mean that she has what she needs and that she will be able to continue in her daily routine.
Mayra would like to continue in her business, provide her family with everything they need and enable her daughter to continue with her studies. As she grows up, she hopes that her daughter will continue on to university.

loan.use: To buy cassava, corn, tomatoes, bananas, plantains and condiments

loan.name: Josefa Lilian

texts.es: Doa Josefa de 62 aos de edad, reside en Mercedes Umaa, departamento de Usulutn, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo uno vive con ella, doa Josefa inicio el negocio hace 25 aos, trabaja de lunes a domingo, por el momento su dificultad es tener el efectivo para invertir en el negocio. El prstamo lo va a utilizar en ropa: pantalones, camisas, blusas, short, entre otras prendas de vestir, esto contribuir al desarrollo que como comerciante debe tener en su negocio, tratar de agradar a los clientes, ofreciendo prendas de vestir de moda. Ella aspira crecer en el negocio, proveer lo necesario para su familia y que su hijo termine sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Josefa is 62 years old and lives in Mercedes Umaa, a municipality in the Usulutn department of El Salvador. She sells clothing and is the mother of three children, one of whom still lives with her. She started her business 25 years ago and she works seven days a week. Currently, she needs capital to invest in her business.
Josefa will apply the loan proceeds toward purchasing clothing: shirts, blouses, and shorts, among other items. This will contribute to the development it is necessary to have as a vendor. She will try to make her customers happy by offering them fashionable apparel. She aspires to grow her business in order to provide for her family and to allow her son to complete his university studies

loan.use: Purchase of clothing items: pants, shirts, blouses, shorts.

loan.name: Jose Odias

texts.es: Don Jos, de 64 aos de edad, reside en Chinameca departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa, dos hijos de 26 y 24 aos de edad, una nieta de 2 aos, don Jos posee un negocio donde ofrece bebidas refrescantes y artculos de primera necesidad, trabaja de lunes a domingo. El solicita un prstamo para la compra de gaseosas, maz, frijol, quesillo, chicharrn, tomates, y otros ms que son necesarios y demandados por los clientes, esta inversin le ayudara a mantenerse competente en el negocio y a que sus ventas mejoren. Su objetivo es continuar incrementando el negocio, contar siempre con la preferencia de sus clientes y ver que sus hijos tengan lo necesario.
texts.en:
Jos is 64 years old. He lives in Chinameca, in San Miguel department, together with his wife, two children aged 26 and 24, and a 2 year-old granddaughter. Jos has a business selling refreshing drinks and essentials. He works from Monday to Sunday.
Jos is requesting a loan to buy soda, corn, beans, 'quesillo' (soft cheese), fried pork rinds, tomatoes and other essential products that are in demand among his customers. This investment will help him to remain competent in his business and improve his sales.
Jos's goal is to continue increasing his business, keep his customers' loyalty and provide his children with what they need.

loan.use: To buy soda, corn, beans, 'quesillo' (soft cheese), fried pork rinds and tomatoes.

loan.name: Margarita Del Carmen

texts.es:
En Meja localizada a unos pocos kilmetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura, al cultivo y venta de cocos se renen cada quince das el Banco Comunal Meja.
La seora Margarita est en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y est muy contenta porque gracias a los crditos que ha recibido de la Fundacin Espoir ha podido mejorar su negocio. Tiene 65 aos y est soltera, no tuvo hijos y vive con una compaera de trabajo. Es una mujer muy activa y alegre que le encanta su trabajo.
Se dedica al comercio vende productos naturales de Omnilive y Forlive, tambin vende semijoyas de Visn, entre los productos que ms vende estn: aloe, fibra, multivitaminas, adelgazantes entre otros. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00. Tambin cra gallinas criollas y vende los huevos y los pollos a muy buen precio ya que son mejores que los de granja.
Este crdito lo va a emplear en comprar ms de sus productos naturales sobretodo los adelgazantes. Sus sueos son tener su casa propia y seguir en su trabajo.
texts.en:
In Meja, which is located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo, a city of people who make thier livings largely in agriculture, farming and selling coconuts, the members of the Banco Comunal Meja (Meja Communal Bank) hold a biweekly meeting.
Seora Margarita has been with the communal bank since its inception. She is very happy with the bank because thanks to the loans she has received from Fundacin Espoir, she has been able to improve her business. She is 65 years old, is single and never had children. She lives with a co-worker. She is an active and happy woman, and she loves her work.
Seora Margarita makes her living selling the natural products Omnilive and Forlive. She also sells Visn costume jewlery. The items she sells the most of are: aloe, fiber, multivitamins and weight-loss products. She works from Monday to Friday from 8:00am-3:00pm. She also raises Creole hens; she gets a good price for the eggs and the chickens she sells because hers are better quality than farm chickens.
She is going to use this loan to purchase more natural products, especially those for wieght loss. Seora Margarita dreams of having her own house and to continue in her work.

loan.use: To purchase Omnilife and Forlive products.

loan.name: Lilia Amparo

texts.es:
En Meja localizada a unos pocos kilmetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura, al cultivo y venta de cocos se renen cada quince das el Banco Comunal Meja.
En este lugar encontramos a la seora Lilia, tiene 55 aos de edad es madre soltera de una hija que en la actualidad es mayor de edad, est casada y vive en su casa junto a su esposo y tres nietos de nuestra amiga.
Se dedica a la venta productos por catlogos de Avon y Esika (artculos de belleza, cosmticos perfumera y accesorios para damas). Trabaja dos das en las entregas y cobros de sus productos ya que deja a crdito y cobra todas las semanas. Nos cuenta que lleva en esta actividad ya por cinco aos y que le va bien. Tambin se dedica ayudar a nios en tareas dirigidas.
Este crdito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutera, cosmticos, cremas y otros productos. Est en el Banco Comunal desde hace 5 ciclos y le gusta porque con estos crditos ella financia su negocio, adems por la responsabilidad de las socias. Su sueo es tener un bazar.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the Meja community bank meet in Meja which is located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo. Most people in this city work in agriculture, growing and selling coconuts.
Here we meet 55 year-old Lilia who is a single mother with one grown-up daughter. Her daughter is married and lives in her home together with her husband and three of Lilia's grandchildren.
Lilia sells Avon and Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories) through catalogs. She works two days a week delivering her products and collecting payment since she leaves her goods on credit and collects payment for them every week. She tells us that she has been in this business for five years and that it is going well. She also helps children with directed tasks.
Lilia will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams and other products. She has been a member of her community bank for 5 loan cycles and she likes it because these loans help her fund her business. She also likes the responsibility of the other group members. Her dream is to own a store.

loan.use: To buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, etc.

loan.name: Aida Mara

texts.es:
En Meja localizada a unos pocos kilmetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura, al cultivo y venta de cocos se renen cada quince das el Banco Comunal Meja.
La seora Aida tiene 69 aos, hace varios aos quedo viuda y de esta relacin tuvo 8 hijos 6 varones y dos mujeres, todos son mayores y comprometidos todos ellos viven aparte pero en las noches dos de sus hijos duermen en su casa para acompaarla. Est en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado tanto a ella como a sus amigas del banco.
Tiene una pequea granja de pollos en su casa en la cual mete hasta cien pollos por temporada, la misma que es de dos o tres meses y luego los vende enteros o por libras a personas de la localidad y adems muchas veces entrega tambin en las tiendas. Trabaja todos los das de dos a tres horas por da en el cuidado y alimentacin de sus animalitos, sus pollos las compras en Agripac en Portoviejo.
Este crdito es para comprar ms pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que estos tengan un buen desarrollo. Sus sueos son tener una granja ms grande y con tecnologa.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of Meja community bank meet in Meja which is located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo. Most of the people in this city work in agriculture, growing and selling coconuts.
Aida is 69 years old. She has been widowed for several years and has 8 children from her relationship: 6 sons and 2 daughters. All of her children are now grown up and engaged. They all live away from home but at night two of her children sleep in her home to keep her company. Aida has been a member of her community bank since the very beginning and she likes being a member because of the help that she and her friends have received from the bank.
Aida has a small chicken farm at home where she keeps up to 100 chickens a season. She keeps them for two or three months and then sells them whole or by the pound to local people. She often delivers them to stores as well. Aida works every day, for two or three hours a day, looking after and feeding her animals. She buys her chickens from Agripac in Portoviejo.
Aida will use this loan to buy more chickens, feed and medicine so that her chickens develop well. Her dream is to own a bigger farm with technology.

loan.use: To buy chickens, medicine and feed for her animals.

loan.name: Aurora Mercedes

texts.es:
En Meja localizada a unos pocos kilmetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura, al cultivo y venta de cocos se renen cada quince das el Banco Comunal Meja.
En este lugar encontramos a la seora Aurora, tiene 53 aos de edad, hace aos su esposos falleci pero de esa relacin tuvo cinco hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes.
Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo como: arroz, azcar, aceites, detergentes, y tambin vende bebidas, como agua, colas y cervezas, en la cual trabaja todos los das desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00, trabaja sola, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayora de sus productos los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva en su negocio ya por 10 aos y que ella se hizo cargo de el una vez que su esposo falleci. Le gusta su negocio ya que en l se entretiene y se olvida un poco de sus penas y de su soledad.
Este crdito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azcar, aceite, detergentes, aguas, sodas, entre otros productos. Est en el Banco Comunal hace 4 aos y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institucin. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada da ms.
texts.en:
The Meja communal bank meets every two weeks in Meja located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo. Meja is a city whose residents are mostly in agriculture growing and selling coconuts.
We found Aurora, 53, here. She was widowed years ago but has five children all of whom are now adult and independent.
She has a grocery store. She sells rice, sugar, oil, detergent and beverages like water, soft drinks and beer. She works alone every day from 8am until 7pm. She buys her merchandise in downtown Portoviejo although most of her merchandise is delivered to her store. She tells us that shes been in business for 10 years and that she took over running it when her husband died. She likes the business because its a distraction for her and she can forget her sorrow and her loneliness for a little while.
She will use this loan to better stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, water and soft drinks, among other products.
Shes been in the communal bank for 4 years and likes it because of the help she gets from the institution. Her goals are to continue forward with her business and that the store grows more every day.

loan.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loan.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 24 year old single man from Bint Jbeil who has been working as an auto repairer for ten years. He opened his own garage in 2006. Five years ago Mohamad decided to take his own responsibility and start his own business. He thought that he couldn't stay as an employee his whole life, so he took the first hard step and struggled to prove himself, even though he had financial problems at the beginning. This is his first time requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, and it's because he wants to buy an electrical car lifting machine necessary to improve his business. Mohamad hopes to improve his business more in the future and open a car maintenance company.

loan.use: To buy an electrical car lifting machine that is important for his business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy more drinks and clothing

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy more plastics bowls and other utensils.

loan.name: Rita

texts.en: This is 34 year-old Rita P.. She is unmarried and has two children. In 2000, Rita P. established her food business. She opens her business five days a week and nine hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more food items for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 700,000. In the future, Rita P. plans to open another business so that her younger ones will be running it for her. In the future she hopes to build a house for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loan.use: To buy more food items for her business

loan.name: Mariatu

texts.en: This is 47 year-old Mariatu N.. She is married and has two children. In 2006, Mariatu N. established her provisions and drinks business. She began her business because she wants to fight poverty and also to reduce the pressures on her husband in running the home. She opens her business six days a week and 11 hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more provisions such as margarine, sardines, sugar, cheese, etc. and drinks. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 800,000. In the future, Mariatu plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

loan.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy materials which will help solve her business problems

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy more fresh fruit and vegetables

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy more goods for his general store

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy some important items for her business

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy a shop for this business and improve it

loan.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika K. is 31 and married. She was born and lived in the Republic of Tadjikistan and grew up in a large family of farmers. From early childhood she had to help her parents in the field where her family cultivated tomatoes, beets and peppers. At the age of 14, Malikas family moved to Kyrgyzstan, where they continue the business of farming.
In 2002 Malika got married and soon became the mother of two children. In order to find a means of subsistence for her family, she decided to start her own business in cattle breeding. With the initial capital of 5,000 KGS, she managed to develop a farm with a monthly profit of 10,000 KGS from selling meat products. Being a very purposeful and positive person, Malika works hard to support her family.
Malika plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to increase the number of cattle. In the future, Malika is planning to give higher education to her children and purchase a car for her family.
Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loan.use: To purchase cattle

loan.name: Raykan

texts.en:
Raykan T. is 47, married and has one child. She graduated as a seller and worked for a long time at the local consumer goods shop.
After privatization, she lost her job and decided to engage in her own business of selling socks. She started with the initial capital of only 500 KGS and managed to develop this activity into a monthly profit of 12,000 KGS. Today Raykan s business includes a wide assortment of socks and women and mens footwear.
Raykan has applied for a loan of 135,000 KGS to broaden the assortment of goods for sale. It will allow her to further develop her business and in the future, to give a higher education to her son.
Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loan.use: To broaden the assortment of footware for sale

loan.name: Darlina

texts.en:
Darlina is a rice farmer living in the town of Aurora, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She cultivates her land to plant and harvest rice crops. Darlina does her best to keep her crops healthy. She also wants to be able to sell the best kind of rice in her town. She works hard to sustain her family and have her own savings.
Darlina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darlina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Darlina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loan.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married, with a son and 2 daughters. She lives in the town of Privetnoye in the Kherson region. Ludmila owns several greenhouses where she grows cabbage, potatoes, radishes, squash and beets. She is an experienced farmer as she has been in this business for 15 years. Ludmila has invested about 100,000 grivnyas in the enterprise. Her average net profit amounts to 4,400 grivnyas a month.
Ludmila is seeking a loan of 15,000 grivnyas to purchase seeds, wood, fertilizer and plastic film. She is planning ahead to make sure her greenhouses are equipped for the upcoming farming season to provide the proper environment for growing plants.

loan.use: To purchase seeds, polyethylene film, wood and fertilizer

loan.name: Yekaterina

texts.en:
Yekaterina is married, with 3 sons and 2 daughters. She lives in the small town of Privetnoye. Yekaterina grows early spring vegetables: Radishes, tomatoes, squash, cabbage, beets, onions and potatoes. She launched this enterprise 5 years ago. She has already invested about 100,000 grivnyas in her business. Her net profit is about 4,000 grivnyas.
Yekaterina is seeking a loan of 13,500 grivnyas to purchase seeds, wood, polyethylene film and fertilizer for her greenhouses. Yekaterina is planning to cover her greenhouses with new plastic film to keep them warm, which she relies on to nurture plants and help them thrive. She is hoping that the current loan will help her make a wise investment in her venture, and flourish in her endeavors.

loan.use: To purchase seeds, wood, polyethylene film and fertilizer

loan.name: Dieumbe

texts.fr: Madame Dieumbe D. est une femme de 38 ans qui volue activement dans le secteur du commerce. Elle est marie et mre de 3 enfants dont lge varie entre 5 et 17 ans. Elle voyage rgulirement vers la Gambie ou vers la Mauritanie pour sapprovisionner en marchandises de toutes sortes plus particulirement les tissus. Madame D. a choisi cette activit dans le but de se procurer des revenus et soutenir son mari dans la gestion des dpenses familiales. Elle habite au quartier de la Mdina mais est socitaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis juillet 2008. Elle sollicite un crdit de 500 000 frs prvu pour lachat de marchandises en vue de renforcer son stock (achat de Bazin, thioub et colliers). Son objectif est de dvelopper son activit, augmenter ses bnfices et complter son pargne en vue dacqurir un terrain.
texts.en: Mrs. Dieumbe D. is a 38 year-old woman who is actively involved in the retail sector. She is married and a mother of three children aged 5 to 17. She regularly travels to Gambia or Mauritania to stock up on all sorts of goods, especially fabrics. Mrs. D. chose this activity to generate an income and support her husband in the management of the family's expenses. She lives in the Mdina neighborhood, but has been a member of the Yoff branch since July 2008. She is requesting a loan for 500,000 XOF, earmarked to acquire merchandise and build up her stock (purchase of African brocade, thioub [an African traditional dyed fabric] and necklaces). Her objective is to expand her business, increase profits, and complement her savings in order to purchase some land.

loan.use: Merchandise purchase

loan.name: Las Americas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Americas est formado por 6 mujeres y 1 hombre que son amigos y viven por distintas comunidades de la ciudad de Cuenca, lugares en donde se dedican a la agricultura y cra de animales, tambin laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades que las que les permiten aportar a la economa de sus hogares. Nuestras socias son mujeres trabajadoras, amables y carismticas quienes en su lucha diaria ayudan a sus familias.
La Seora. Rosa Q. vive por la comunidad de Tutupali Chico, se encuentra en su primer crdito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su prima quien pertenece al grupo.
